programme.title: Beyond Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: Andy and Paul visit a ranch rumored to be the site of numerous cattle mutilations and strange deaths to investigate a mystical hornets nest.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers he cant fit under his favourite hiding log anymore. With Big Nutbrown Hares help, he learns he has grown bigger since last Spring, and can now clamber into a hole in a tree thats an even better hiding place. Big Nutbrown Hare learns that you are never too young to play.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Big Nutbrown Hare tells Little Nutbrown Hare a beautiful full moon will rise that night, Little Nutbrown wants to invite all his friends around for a celebration. When the full moon is veiled in clouds, Little Nutbrown is disappointed - but is extra delighted when the clouds part to reveal a bright red moon.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and his friends are making a train out of lots of different shapes. Can you help them?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Trying to figure out what a strange piece of metal with a number 10 on it is, Huckle and his pals take it to Blacksmith Bear who helps them discover strange writing on it. Figuring it must be a foreign language, they take it to Ms Honey and, with her help, determine the piece of metal is a lost tap from Hilda’s French tap dance shoes./Huckle and pals set out to find the whistle blower who is causing a traffic jam.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is running around in his garden and notices his shadow chasing him and copying everything he does! Trying to figure out how to get rid of it, he goes to Okido. When he arrives, his shadow has followed him and then he spots more shadows on the side of Felix and Zoe’s house. He looks up to find his friends on the balcony of their treehouse, making shadow puppets. He bounces up to join them and then all of a sudden the shadows disappear…

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is hiding in a tent made of cushions, pretending not to be scared of the storm outside! He wonders why the sky is flashing and being so noisy! So he spins to Okido to find the answer. When Messy arrives, Zoe and Felix are lounging, warm and dry in deck chairs, but it appears to be raining on him, and he can’t escape it! “Look up Messy!” giggles Zoe. It’s Fluff the cloud! She’s been watering Felix and Zoe’s garden and now needs to go home so invites the trio to come and meet her family.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Berrykin Blooms braggart cousin, Berrykin Bertram, has won the hot sauce competition at the local county fair year after year. But this year, Sour and Apple are determined to help the kindhearted Bloom win... whether he wants to or not!

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is finding it difficult to learn to play the violin and is fearful about performing in his school concert so he goes to Dino-World to practice.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry discovers that he is too small to pick apples he goes to the Dino-World Mooseum to find some growth enhancing milk from a mechanical cow.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In this rainforest adventure, Peyo, while collecting colorful flowers, encounters a tiny, vibrant Poison Dart Frog. Pico goes into protective mode, preventing Peyo from getting too close to the potentially dangerous frog. He calls Leo and Katie, who checks on the computer and learns about Poison Dart Frogs, emphasizing their toxic nature. The frog suddenly jumps into Peyo’s satchel which calls for the team to travel to the rainforest to address the situation. As they arrive, Leo manages to get the frog out of the satchel with his grabber but the frog ends up jumping around which causes a commotion with everyone being scared to get too close. Suddenly, Ranger Rocky shows up and the frog is nowhere to be found! On high alert, they look around for the frog which ends up being on Ranger Rocky’s hat which he gently places on the ground and Peyo retrieves his satchel safely. However, the frog then jumps onto Hero’s backpack and gets flung onto a floating leaf in a river, prompting a rescue mission as they learnt that the frog is not a good swimmer. Using quick thinking and Peyo’s satchel, the Junior Rangers save the frog and find a suitable spot for it to rest by the river. Back in the Treehouse, Leo hangs a photo of the frog while Katie commends Hero’s smelling skills and deems them better than Leo’s.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: One day while levelling the site for Wellsworth Hospital’s new parking lot/car park, Brenda finds that someone had dumped a large mound of stone right in her cleaned-up work site. She thinks Monty and Max are responsible and so she clears the stone away. Little did she know that it was the stone for filling in the hospital’s extension foundations Jack and Alfie have just dug out. They wonder what became of the stone when they arrive to collect it. Miss Jenny asks for Nia to bring more stone from the quarry but even that load goes missing, not long after Jack unloads it. Where could it have gone to? Everyone soon finds the answer and the outcome is also quite convenient for both the pack and Brenda.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Emily worries she doesnt have a best friend, but, when the other engines help her out of a tricky situation, she realises shes been surrounded by best friends all along.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: To help David who has to take off for a firefghter operation, Grisu offers to bring a package to the post office. Even if the package matters a lot for David since its a birthday present for his best friend, the mission shouldnt be too difficult. Except that, after an accident, the package ends up in Guellecs van, then in a field with playful sheeps. Grisu and Stella miss the mail and therefore have to deliver the package by themselves. What they will manage to do, thanks to Grisus invention: a cart pulled by drones!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Fume asks his son to watch over the water plant while hes away. Grisu accepts this mission and Stella comes along. But the young dragon accidently pulls the wrong lever, causing the water to heat too much. To cool it down, Grisu and Stella have to turn a wheel but they end up getting it unhinged. Fortunately Grisu and Stella manage to press a red button, which is a like a second line of defence. But their mishaps made the volcano shake and a boulder flattens a hot water hose. As Grisu tries to dislodge it, Fume shows up in the plant unanounced, which makes Stella shout in surprise and startled Grisu burn two stalagmites holding the boulder.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a snowy Winter’s morning Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are amazed at the intricate patterns they find in the snowflakes, each one different from the others. The friends try to take one to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but they always melt before he sees them. Will they find a way to stop the lovely flakes from melting?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that he has grown a thick Winter coat, he and Little Field Mouse make a coat from moss to help other creatures in the meadow stay warm. They discover that everyone has their own ways of coping in the colder months, but Big Nutbrown Hare uses the coat as a picnic rug on the snow so they can enjoy a Winter feast.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson is flown to a secret location by Action Chugger and has to navigate his way home, using Dr. Ling’s new invention – the Chugnav. When a squirrel accidentally knocks the Chugnav upside down and back to front, causing it to malfunction, Wilson gets hopelessly lost. But once he figures out that he should do the opposite of what the Chugnav tells him, he gets back safely and earns his badge!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy’s latest collection is made up of a staggering 345 pine cones that he has hidden in the guest room. Edmund is furious and asks his son to find another place for his collection. After several unsuccessful attempts, Woodsy finally chooses Loudo’s underground burrow. Just when he thinks he has found the perfect place, he gets a big surprise.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: It’s the Machine’s Check Up Day; a day when Curtis the mechanic comes to check their mechanics and engines are all working properly! Scoop boast he’s going to get ‘top marks’ for his check-up. Lofty is worried he won’t get any. After Scoop, Lofty and Muck have a Jet-Wash, Bob calls Curtis to tell him they’re ready but Scoop realises his orange emergency light is broken and thinks he won’t get ‘top marks’. He panics and decides to hide until Curtis has gone! Scoop scours the Yard for somewhere to hide – but in the process makes himself muddy again. Then he breaks the glass in his side mirror before tearing his rear tyre mud flap. Eventually Bob finds Scoop hiding behind a pile of cement bags, looking dishevelled and sorry for himself! Bob and Wendy ‘fix’ Scoop so he’s ready for his check-up. Lofty is still worried and nervous about being examined.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Roland Sweet has commissioned Bob and Team to build a giant games testing area outside the Shopping Mall to publicise the opening of his new games store. Leo impresses Roland with his musical knowledge, so Roland asks if he can assemble the giant piano keyboard while the rest of the team build a child-sized doll’s house and Snakes and Ladders board. Bob asks Scoop to help Leo with the keyboard and but Scoop mixes up the piano keys when moving them. Leo is too proud to follow the diagram Roland gave him so he and Scoop muddle through, treating the keyboard like a jigsaw.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Huckle and the gang hear strange mumbling voices in the Busytown Museum, it begins to look like it’s coming from the new Mummy Exhibit. However, after tracking down the clues and putting them together, the sounds turn out to be the voices of the workmen echoing up through air vents from the basement.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo meets an Atlantic puffin in the garden while playing with his remote-controlled car. The Junior Rangers decide to take the puffin home to Iceland. There, Leo has a mishap at the edge of a cliff.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: After an Asian palm civet steals Hero’s food, the Junior Rangers set off to bring the civet back to where it belongs. The trip takes them to the rainforest, a durian plantation and a run-in with a wild boar!

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon doesnt want to play with Gaspard any more because of his really stinky blankie, but it turns out that a really stinky blankie may still have its uses yet...

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, Stanley, Balthazar, Flutter and Bubble are hiking in the forest on a beautiful autumn day. Suddenly they recognized that someone is crying in the bush. They found a mushroom without his hat. The friends immediately start to help him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One spring day, Frank longhorn beetle visits his friend, Stanley. Frank suggests to organize a football match. Everyone wants to play football, the two teams get together quickly. The girls cheer on the sidelines. The game is about to start.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Easter is here. The girls: Dolly, Flutter, Leapy, Zephyr and Rosita gather and start to paint the Easter eggs. They happily work all day, painting beautiful eggs.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One night Berry is already in his bed, when he hears some strange noise. First he doesnt care, but the noise just getting louder. Finally he opens the door when the little green worm appeared. Long time no see friend just arrived.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One night, Berry and Dolly saw a shiny thing falling from the sky. Fearfully, they head to the depths of the forest to find out what the strange light might be. They found a star-shaped house and a girl.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One day Berry and Flutter played a board game. The first round was won by Berry, and the second one was won by him as well. In the third round, Flutter finished first. Berry got very angry. They played another round, but Flutter won again. Berry couldn’t help but made a scene.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its bedtime but wheres Hoppity? Bing remembers playing with him in the garden so Flop finds a torch and together they set off in the dark for an adventure.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If you get stuck, you need some help and then you can get down by yourself.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunnys friends gather for a cake party.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Mole mother Gertrud has a cold, so Tilda watches her kids. The children teach Tilda how to dig. Unfortunately, Tilda’s tunnel leads directly to Rupert, who’s upset about the molehills in his garden.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: New guests arrive at Guesthouse Appleseed – the famous band “The Merry Mice” and two hares who want to record birds singing. But with the mice practising their music, the hares can’t hear any birds.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda asks Edna to repair her entrance door that creaks so loudly that her guests want to leave Guesthouse Appleseed. But normally, Rupert does all repairing work for Tilda and interferes.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Summer meadow is home to a many amazing treasures of nature. When Little Nutbrown Hare finds a beautiful blue butterfly, he and Little Field Mouse go on a hunt for other blue treasures to bring back and show Big Nutbrown Hare, including blueberries, blue bells and even blue eggshells. Meanwhile, Big Nutbrown Hare has discovered the biggest blue treasure of them all. What could it be?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare wakes early one Summer morning before the sun has risen. Big Nutbrown Hare sends Little Nutbrown Hare off to invite his friends for breakfast so he can rest a little longer. Along the way Little Nutbrown Hare discovers how wonderful and different all his friends homes are. Will Little Nutbrown Hare still love his own home as much as he did?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The series follows a warm father-son relationship that Little Nutbrown Hare decides he wants a clever long tail like his friends, rather than a short fluffy one. They help out by making him a long tail but all the results are either too tickly, bendy or flappy. When Big Nutbrown Hare spots his son from way across a grassy field everyone realizes that Little Nutbrown Hare’s little tail is clever in its own way.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon is excited about the train on a journey to the mountains with the whole family. After a good nights sleep in their sleeper carriage, they’re still in their pyjamas by the time they arrive!.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A young California Sea Lion makes a surprise appearance during Leo’s basketball game. Later, a voyage to find the sea lion’s home turns into a daring rescue on the high seas.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Olwin asks Brewster to take a long line of heavy cars to the quarry. He gives it his best shot, but really struggles to pull the heavy load up the steep hill. He just isn’t capable on his own. Brewster doesn’t want to let Olwin down so he asks Koko to help him, even though he thinks it means forfeiting his badge. They get the cars to the quarry and Olwin explains that being capable means carrying out a task in the best way, no matter how you do it. Brewster has proved himself a very ‘capable’ chugger indeed.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson and Brewster forget their fire safety rules during a drill and miss out on earning their badges – but they learn from their mistakes and when there’s a real fire, they know just what to do.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Luce has brought one of T’choupi’s favorite games: a Seek And Find game based on Nature! Mom comes along and suggests they go for a walk in the forest. The kids love the idea… as long as we can bring the game with! Mom agrees. But on the way, Luce drops the game, losing some of the pieces. She doesn’t say anything to the others, but when the time comes to start playing, the missing pieces make it impossible to continue past a certain point! Oh nooo!! So Mom suggests they play Seek And Find for real, in the forest! The first one to find a chestnut, a hedgehog or a frog…!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi loves picking vegetables in the vegetable garden! But when Mom asks him if he remembered to water the tomato plants, as per her request this morning, he freaks out: he was too busy having fun and forgot! In a mad rush, he gets Nina to help him find a way to keep Mom busy while he quickly waters the tomatoes. But it just doesn’t seem to work: the plants look positively sick!... But, what if there’s another way to tend to vegetables…?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When Fred gives his daughter Nina a little badge, officially recognizing her as a farmer,Tchoupi gets envious: he wants a farmer badge too! Nina warns him: it’s not that easy, but Tchoupi believes he can do it and begins learning the ropes in earnest, following his friend’s instructions. He does pretty well with it… until the greedy goat escapes from her pen and makes a beeline for the large vegetable garden! Poor Tchoupi: doesn’t look like he’ll be getting that badge any time soon…!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Medhi teaches Charley and his friends the basics of first aid. The children love it and immediately think theyre nurses! They even form a patrol that roams the playground in the hope of saving someone. But the children are disappointed, no one gets hurt... until Medhi, who is clowning around, finally gives them a chance to practise...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia want to play as if they own a restaurant. But its not so easy to decide on the menu, the name of the place, and to manage their first difficult customers, Ella and Tonio.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: While playing against Tonio, Julia lost Sams beautiful marble. The two mice do everything to recover it, but Julia would like to understand why this marble was so precious to him...

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Everyone is happy at Christmastime except for Duncan, who seems to be grumbling more than usual. Victor offers Duncan a new coat of paint if he can keep from grumbling for one day.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Duncan is the grumpiest engine on the narrow gauge railway. He is always complaining about one thing or another. But when Duncan gets a very grumpy passenger, Duncan finds his grumpiness very annoying. So he decides to do everything he can to make the grumpy passenger stop complaining. But Duncan soon learns that you can’t make everyone happy.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou takes part in the egg race and learns to keep trying and never give up!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Captain Caillou goes on an underwater adventure to help a mermaid find treasure!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Huckle, Lowly and Sally find a lost bag, they use the eyeglass case, atomizer, map, and a red scarf inside it to determine that the owner is a famous international opera star who’s come to Busytown to perform for the first time./Cyclists getting flat tires somewhere in Busytown lead Huckle and the gang on a mystery.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: All Monkey wants is to eat a nice fresh carrot, but someone has beat him to it. When Monkey discovers that the rabbit is the carrot eater he immediately invites him to play Monkey’s favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: It is night time at the jungle, it is dark and Monkey hears a strange a noise. Who is making that noise? Whooooo? It is the owl and he is hooting hello. Monkey is happy to meet his friend and to invite him to join him in his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: An underwater shoot goes wrong when James gets wedged in the rocks, just as the tide starts coming in!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: A hunt for dinosaur bones leads to a search and rescue mission with the Police Helicopter, FireSwift, Radar and Shadow!

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: After Bear shows great promise at Woodland Stickball, a new game Aunt T shows the kids, Franklin takes it upon himself to act as Bear’s personal coach. But when Franklin takes the “training” too far and forgets to give Bear a chance to rest and have fun, he ends up turning his pal off the new sport – until he realizes that, above all, learning a new skill should be fun! / Franklin plans a Day with Dad, just like Fox has with his Dad, but Mr. Turtle’s busy schedule interrupts his plans. Only when Franklin learns that it is not what you’re doing but who you’re doing it with does the Day with Dad become a success.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: As the snow and the cold have settled outside, the Fox-Badger family must remain within the warmth of the burrow. A blessing for the four practically hibernating badgers who spend their time yawning and napping! As for Rosie, she hates staying indoors: the little vixen needs to spend her excess energy!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Its spring, the season of lovers and flowers! Sketcky would very much like to offer one to Bubble but first we need to let it grow and especially protect it against all kinds of threats. Doodleboo knows exactly what it takes to get away from anyone who wants to steal his friends seed...

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky would like to discover the secrets and hidden treasures of Mother Nature. But it is not the spider who weaves its web that can accompany him! Doodleboo has a Riddleboo that will do the trick...

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: 1 ride, 2 rides, 3 rides.... 10 rides! In the competition of going around in circles, Sketcky gets dizzy quickly! Doodleboo knows a Riddleboo that is as pretty as Bubble!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave help Larry the Leopard find his way to the play park, and safely home again, by making him a map. They draw all the roads and pathways Larry needs to follow, adding signs and landmarks en route to remind him which way to go. When they arrive at the play park they have fun riding on their favourite ride, the merry-go-round!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave throw a big party for all their countryside and jungle friends. Invitations are sent out to tell everyone the time and place. Decorations are put up and party food prepared. DJ-Dave gets the party started with some cool music and soon everyone’s having fun dancing and tucking into their favourite snacks. There’s even time for Hatty’s favourite party game!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Chilly Autumn winds blow as Little Nutbrown Hare chases the beautiful fallen leaves. When one wafts so high that only a bird could catch it Little Nutbrown Hare wishes he could fly as well. He and Little Field Mouse try every way they can think of to fly, without luck. They have fun trying, however, and along the way they discover they have their own very special talents.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Crisp Autumn days are perfect for collecting pretty golden leaves and playing hide and boo. Little Nutbrown Hare is so excited that he accidently promises to play with two different games with two different friends on the same day. He can’t be in two places at once, so how will he keep both his promises and both his friends happy?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A fun, spooky tale from little White Owl leaves the friends a little on edge, so when they hear strange noises in the pumpkin patch, they wonder what kind of creepy creature might be lurking there with them. Will Big Nutbrown Hare be able to convince them not to let their imaginations run away with them?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula help Flop water plants in the garden. Bing finds a frog and wants to keep it, so he and Sula decide to build her a little house with a bucket. Sula and Bing prepare a cozy house with food and a bed, but the frog doesnt like the new house so it hops away. Where can she be?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to play his car park game, but Charlie is visiting and keeps messing it up.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop play shadow tag until it starts raining and Bings shadow is outside getting wet.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its Bings turn to choose a game at Ammas crèche so he picks Musical Statues but gets upset when he loses because he chose the game.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bings mini racing car and the cereal box collide, they make a big mess. Voo Voo the vacuum cleaner does his job well - maybe even too well!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The owl chicks dont understand why the mirror copies them. Mama Owl brings them a new mirror but accidentally places it opposite the old one, so the little owls marvel as they multiply in it. Doctor Owl securely attaches the new mirror in the nursery, where the chicks can play and have fun.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends spend the afternoon playing hide and seek. Berry hides so well among the water lily petals that he falls asleep and drifts away on the water. Luckily, the Moon Beetle and the Moon itself help him get back home. The next day, all the little friends play a big game of hide and seek together in the meadow.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Stanley, the stag beetle, and his friends excitedly try out the new traffic park, practicing the rules of the road with roller skates, scooters, bicycles, and small motorcycles. However, Balthazar, the bee, ignores the signs and causes a minor accident by driving recklessly. With the help of the Queen Ant, the little friends learn traffic rules and signs so they can play safely and happily together.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In the fall, the chimney sweep smoke beetle visits the forest friends to clean their chimneys. In Patricks chimney, he finds a shiny hair clip that turns out to be a gift Dolly sent to Katie via Pigeon Post. The friends solve the mystery together, and Katie finally receives the shiny hair clip.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Hilda arrives at Sallys dance party, shes suddenly struck with a severe case of the sneezes. Thinking shes come down with a cold, her friends take her to Doctor Lion who informs her she has an allergy to something. It turns out shes allergic to her best friend Sally - or rather, the new rose-scented perfume Sallys wearing./Huckle, Lowly and Sally find they have their mystery-solving hands full when things start disappearing, in the blink of an eye!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Parrot is writing a letter to his great uncle using a quill and ink from a bottle Monkey tips over when trying to show off his juggling skills. There is no more ink left. Mole appears and tells them that octopus uses ink to ward off predators. They fly to the ocean and try to scare the Octopus so he will spurt his ink.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: While Lizzie teaches at the Fire Station, Norman and Hannah help keep things running at the Pontypandy Vets… except both sheep manage to escape AND Norman startles Prince the horse, who runs away and gets stuck in sinking mud at the tidal flats!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: While taking her class on a tour of the airport, Mrs Chen accidentally lifts off in FireSwift and it’s up to Norman to use his gaming skills to control the aircraft until the Rescue Team arrives!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate And Mim Mim

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Enchanted by its hopping, Kate captures a grasshopper, but as soon as it’s in the jar, it stands still. In Mimiloo, Kate and Mim-Mim help Lily try to capture some amazing new Mimiloo critters to learn all about them. The mysterious, playful creatures lead them on a wild chase, but when they’re captured, they turn out to be super shy!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When Fanni accidentally knocks over Tchoupi and Nina’s cushion cabin, it prompts them to build a real cabin, in the forest, opening up a whole new adventure! However, when they get to the forest, Tchoupi grows increasingly scared after spotting a spider! In the end, however, he realizes that the animals of the forest are actually way more nervous than he is!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi misses out on going to the market with Fred, Nina decides to cheer him up by suggesting they sell their wares at the market, like a couple of adults -right there, in the hamlet where they live! The friends find some great produce, which they then promptly sell to their parents. The latter are delighted with their wares; only problem is, Dad would have loved to be able to bake a yummy pie but has no eggs with which to make it…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia find the boisterous Tonio frozen like a statue, in the yard, when he was supposed to bring them a snack! And he doesnt talk anymore, even though hes usually a real chatterbox...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam has a very bad night. He only finds sleep when he lies down on the floor in the morning. Julia finds him there and tries to understand how to get Sam back to sleeping well, in his own bed.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: It is almost winter in Wild Rose Lane and the inhabitants are getting their provisions in. Hedgehog Rupert is looking forward to hibernating. But Tilda is sad at the thought of all the nice things her best friend will miss while hes asleep. With the promise that she will cook for him, she persuades Rupert to stay awake and spend the winter at her place.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mommy is coming home! The Triplets run to welcome her when they realize her favorite flowerpot has been knocked down and broken. But who could do such a thing? The Triplets decide to hide the flowerpot but unfortunately Mommy sees it and asks to know who did this. Since no one replies, she states a fault confessed is half redressed and she gives them five minutes to find the guilty one. Who did this? Girl with her tea party? Turbulent with his soccer ball? Or Poet with his violin? Or maybe someone else?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: It’s the end of the day at the beach and the Triplets want an ice cream. Mommy says they won’t be hungry for dinner when she prepares for them a delicious soup of stinging nettles and a juicy ox tongue. When she sees their reaction, Mommy challenges them to fish their dinner and everything they’ll find will end in their plate. The Triplets are more than excited, which one of them will bring the biggest fish? But unfortunately, our heroes will only catch a disgusting, sticky jellyfish. They hope Mommy wont’ make them eat it

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie, Woodsy and Scoutbadger have decided to play a big game of hide-and-seek, but their plan falls through when their parents announce that, in the afternoon, they have to babysit their kid sister Berry. Despite her brothers doubts, Rosie suggests that Berry take part in the game. It quickly becomes obvious that Berry is too little for a real hide-and-seek.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou chooses a new adventure to read using his free book voucher!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: When Caillou tries out some of Leos prank toys, his family is in for a surprise!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Judy and Jerome, the breakdown train, have been stuck at Knapford Yard for some time – having been somewhat superseded by Rocky and even Harvey. Ryan hears their sad story and offers to take them to Arelsburgh Harbour for a change of scenery. They love it there at first but soon take advantage of other engines so they can have a tour around the island. Meanwhile, Daisy has a run in with a bull and is derailed. When Thomas goes looking for the breakdown train, it is nowhere to be found! Ryan feels responsible – not just for Daisy but also to make sure Judy And Jerome get to be Really Useful. Ryan catches up with Judy and Jerome in the end and The Fat Controller is reminded how useful they can be. He decides they will have a new home at Arlesburgh with their friends Ryan and Daisy.

programme.title: Chuggington 04
programme.desc: Koko gets hooked on a computer game trying to beat Hodge’s high score. She becomes so obsessed that she neglects to be safe on the rails.

programme.title: Chuggington 04
programme.desc: After an encounter with a magnetic crane, Wilson finds himself magnetized and attracting a lot of unwanted attention!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Medhi teaches Charley and his friends the basics of first aid. The children love it and immediately think theyre nurses! They even form a patrol that roams the playground in the hope of saving someone. But the children are disappointed, no one gets hurt... until Medhi, who is clowning around, finally gives them a chance to practise...

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Hatty, Tweet and Dave help Ruff-Ruff make up a story about pirates! Captain Ruff-Ruff, Pirate Dave and Princess Pirate Tweet go in search of treasure on Desert Island, singing a pirate song as they go. Ruff-Ruff want to dig for buried treasure, but his pirate crew find a treasure chest, filled with all their favourite things, aboard a real pirate ship! The pirates agree to share the treasure and Hatty records Ruff-Ruff’s story in a special storybook.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who is the hide and seek master in the garden? Doddleboo explains how to draw a mole.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers make a trip to the jungle to reunite a shy pangolin with its mother. There, the Junior Rangers come face to face with a ferocious tiger!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends watch slides and then play a lively game of shadow puppets. They continue the game in front of a rock wall, forming funny shapes. Bubble, the little rose beetle, gets scared by the strange shadows on the wall, thinking a giant monster has moved into the forest. Luckily, Christopher, the canary, helps clarify the misunderstanding. Bubble and Christopher join the fun shadow play.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Eddy, the potato beetle, notices he cant see well from a distance, so on Dollys advice, he visits Dr. Owl. Eddy needs glasses, so he and Dolly visit Fly Flynn, the optician. Eddy is delighted to rediscover the joy of sharp vision and can finally see the birds lively concert clearly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble is peacefully resting in the meadow when a bored cloud playfully pours rain on him, making the rose beetle angry. When Bubble tries to catch the cloud, he gets hurt. The cloud regrets its prank and apologizes. To make amends, it offers to fly Bubble over the forest, who happily waves to his friends from above. By the end of the adventure, the cloud and Bubble become good friends.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The owl chicks dont understand why the mirror copies them. Mama Owl brings them a new mirror but accidentally places it opposite the old one, so the little owls marvel as they multiply in it. Doctor Owl securely attaches the new mirror in the nursery, where the chicks can play and have fun.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends spend the afternoon playing hide and seek. Berry hides so well among the water lily petals that he falls asleep and drifts away on the water. Luckily, the Moon Beetle and the Moon itself help him get back home. The next day, all the little friends play a big game of hide and seek together in the meadow.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Bing tag all their favourite things around the house with stickers, but when Sula tags Hoppity Voosh Bing is upset because he doesnt want to share.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants Flop to read him a story when he has his bath but gets sad when his book gets wet. Flop helps him to understand that even though the book is wet, the story isnt.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has a great time choosing the perfect present for Sula in Padgets shop. Its a wand and is sparkly and flashy and spinny and Bing knows that she will love it. Bing is thrilled until it is time to hand the present over.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to try Coco’s Hula Hoop. It’s harder than it looks but he finds lots of other hoopy games as he tries. Just as Bing almost gets it right he gets carried away with spinning, trips over and breaks the hoop. Coco is upset that she can’t hula anymore until Bing and Charlie remind her of all the other games they can still do with the bent hoop.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are in the park playing at being giants and splashing in puddles with their big welly boots. As they play the puddles get bigger and bigger until Bing slips over in the mud and gets wet everywhere. Amma comes to the rescue with a giant warm bath and a giant carroty bagel.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When the girls discover that Apples groove booties can teach the pups to dance, Plum gets an idea for a Doggie Dance Show. Wanting to impress them, Huck offers to have TomTom join the show... despite the pups obvious dislike of performing in public. Its up to Strawberry to help Huck see that he should not force TomTom into something he just doesnt want to do.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmund tells the story of how, as a child, his father woke him up one morning before sunrise to show him the gift of dawn. Ever since then, Edmund wakes up very early every morning to enjoy it. Intrigued, Rosie, Berry, Scoutbadger and Woodsy ask to see the gift, but Edmund claims that they are still too little. They will have to wait one or two more years to know about it!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare watches as Blue Bird’s eggs hatch into three happy, chirpy baby birds. Fascinated and charmed by these youngsters, he visits them every day and even helps teach them to sing, play and fly. But how will he feel when Summer is on its way and they are ready to fly the nest and make homes of their own?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s Spring blossom season and the pretty pink blossoms that come floating down the stream remind Big Nutbrown Hare of a magnificent cherry tree from his youth. He sets off cross- country to find it, with Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, but the journey is longer and harder than he remembered. Will the blossoms floating downstream give them a clue as to a shorter way home?

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble is peacefully resting in the meadow when a bored cloud playfully pours rain on him, making the rose beetle angry. When Bubble tries to catch the cloud, he gets hurt. The cloud regrets its prank and apologizes. To make amends, it offers to fly Bubble over the forest, who happily waves to his friends from above. By the end of the adventure, the cloud and Bubble become good friends.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: To help his little brother Ben feel less frustrated by his young age, Sam decided to help him. Together with Julia, they try to come up with a good scheme to make him feel like a hero.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have decided to play doctors to help their friends stuffed animals and heal dolls hurts. Dr. Julia and Sam, her nurse, pay visits to some of them in the Mouse Mansion.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are quietly playing cards on the top bunk and Turbulent is taking all the place, which annoys Girl and Poet. Turbulent replies that if theyre unhappy, they can leave HIS bed! For Turbulent, his bed is a dungeon and you can only enter with the right imaginary ticket ! To get even with him, Girl and Poet decide to make their bed become an hotel and a restaurant in THEIR bed. And Turbulent is not welcome. Nobody is happy with their place anymore. Mommy will have to find a clever way to close the argument.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Today Poet is sick, he can’t go to school and Mommy decides to prepare him a good hot milk with honey. Girl and Turbulent are so jealous and they wonder if Poet would not be Mommy’s favorite! Once they come home from school, they even find Poet in Mommy’s bed: there is no doubt anymore, he is her favorite! They decide to take a drastic decision, they will leave the house, let Mommy and Poet alone and they will regret it. But Mommy has a solution of her own to put an end to this conflict.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Wilson finds out hes the first of his kind. His friends deem him Chuggington Royalty.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: While Lizzie teaches at the Fire Station, Norman and Hannah help keep things running at the Pontypandy Vets… except both sheep manage to escape AND Norman startles Prince the horse, who runs away and gets stuck in sinking mud at the tidal flats!
